result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin O Knox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Conditions as listed/stated in count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin O Knox

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin O Knox in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Justin O Knox in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Amended information filed.
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
Plea hearing continued....
As to both counts in the amended information:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing continued....
As to both counts:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months as to count 1 and 60 days as to count 2 in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days served; Court Stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 15 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete a course in anger management, if appropriate..
 AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Court ordered a fine of $300.00 as to count 1, Pay DV surcharge (count 2) plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.


  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 23.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Defendant Justin O Knox in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
BRANCH 17 FOR BRANCH 23
Court orders signature bond reinstated. All conditions to remain the same.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case spun to Judge Stark, branch 17.

Defendant Justin O Knox in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case RECALLED. Defendant appeared in court. Court admonished defendant to appear in court at scheduled time. Court VACATED the bench warrant. Case passed to find a spin court for this matter. Branch 25 is using Branch 23 courtroom. Case PASSED.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause previously in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant did NOT appear in court.   Case set for Plea & Sentencing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense.

Received & Filed, Information. 
Count 1: Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 941.30(2), 939.50(3)(g), 97.055(1), a class G Felony.
Count 2: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.50(3)(b), 97.055(1), a class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant Justin O Knox in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Arraignment. State not prepared to proceed with Arraignment today. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Plea & Sentencing date, and WAIVED the time limits as to filing of the Information and Arraignment hearing. Case set for Arraignment and Plea & Sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin O Knox in court with attorney Ann Jaspers for Bridget Joy Krause.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jedidiah Thompson-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. State is requesting an Arraignment date before the Court.   Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Arraignment scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jimmy B.

Defendant Justin O Knox in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Justin O Knox in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
